website_summaries.verdict: Want a superior gaming and video streaming modem but don't want to shell out the cash for a Nighthawk X10? Have a look at this one.
pros: 6 powered antennas do wonders for range and connectivity, plus the fast CPU can handle a lot of devices at once
cons: Some users report that you have to reboot frequently to keep it working reliably

website_summaries.verdict: Even when it's working well, the Netgear R8000 Nighthawk X6 AC3200 Tri-Band Gigabit Wireless Router has nothing to justify its expensive price tag.
pros: The all-new Netgear R8000 Nighthawk X6 AC3200 Tri-Band Gigabit Wireless Router has powerful hardware and excellent Wi-Fi data rates on the 5Ghz frequency band
When coupled with an external hard drive, the router also functions as a robust NAS server
cons: The router has a buggy 2.4Ghz band and comparatively short Wi-Fi range, and -- when all is working as intended -- it doesn't perform any better than other AC1900 routers

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old tplink wireless router, and after it would disconnect a lot I needed to get another one. I did a lot of research and after looking into my max speeds and range needed this one was the best choice for me. It maximizes all my speeds on 2ghz and 5ghz never fails, strong connections, has great protection, and I got it with a $20 coupon! Remember if ur looking at the higher models, check out wether ur internet speed is fulfilled with the right one. Don't buy one that has a capacity u can't touch.
customer_reviews.author: Katkiller13Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Expensive piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This Netgear broke on the 91st day I had it. It just stopped working for no apparent reason. The company gave me a very hard time about returning this. Then they wanted to charge me a re-stocking fee! How do you re-stock a defective product? Maybe this was just a fluke, but the way they, Netgear, handled this situation was such a turn off to me.
customer_reviews.author: plg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it for parental controls.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a scam. The reason I got this router was for parental controls and after doing the install I understand that you need to pay extra for all the circle parental control features. All you get is very basic parental controls. Nowhere in the description is it mentioned so. Netgear, you need to be upfront about it in the product description. I am returning this router, period.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaw

customer_reviews.title: Requires constant restarts
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK initially though I had a lot of issues on the 2.4GHz band. We're on a 1/2 acre lot with no close neighbors to crowd the signal so I was disappointed there. Unfortunately, it's now dying on me and is has to be rebooted multiple times a day to get any devices to connect to it. It's not even 3 months old. It's too late to return it or I would. Update: After talking to their support. Apparently 2 laptops, 4 tablets, 2 phones, 2 wifi cameras, and 2 Amazon Fire TVs is too much for their high-end Nighthawk router and I should "disconnect any devices [I'm] not using." Luckily Amazon has better customer service than Netgear does.
customer_reviews.author: T. McMaster

customer_reviews.title: Great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Set this up and it worked great for 5 days. Speed was impeccable. Liked all of the parental control options and such. Then it simply stopped working. Called support and they walked us through the usual steps. Eventually they said it was faulty and would send us a replacement. Got the replacement and the same thing happened after 15 minutes of being plugged in. Sent both back and am now avoiding netgear. So if it works I assume it would be a great router. In my case it simply didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Randy I

customer_reviews.title: This Netgear Router is a big disappointment to me
customer_reviews.text: This Netgear Router is a big disappointment to me, i tried resetting it to factory setting and updating the software multiple times, followed all those recommendation give here, did all the configuration and i was still experiencing connection issues. Especially the laptops and cell phones internet connection was intermittent, though the signal signal was great. I have about 18 wifi connected devices at house and this"SMART" router could not handle it and i had to return it. I believe they have some major software limitation issues. I had to switch back to my normal At&T router which works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Sue N.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router out of box
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my previous router dropping our internet sporadically. I replaced it with this one. I'm not a hard core techie so if you want an in depth review of the specs look somewhere else. I will say that I haven't had any connection problems and my speed is super fast! The signal is strong throughout both floors of my house. I like the built-in VPN features so there's no need to flash the router. It has all the functionality it needs right out of the box for someone who wants a great router but doesn't necessarily want to do a completely custom setup. And it looks bada$$ too!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous 321

customer_reviews.title: Bricked ------  NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Dual Band WiFi Router, MU-MIMO, Circle with Disney Smart Parental Controls (R6900P)
customer_reviews.text: Clicked to install firmware update, it failed and bricked the unit a week out of the return window. After several hours on the phone with Netgear, they shipped me a new unit. This one is working well so far. The parental control leaves a lot to be desired. Had I realized that it would be so lackluster, I would not have purchased this router. You can only set filtering levels. If you want to set device limits or bedtimes,you must use Disney Circle and pay a monthly fee. Nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RMA SUPPORT VERY BAD!
customer_reviews.text: Have issue with WAN port twice! Not reliable product. BAD SUPPORT PROCEDURE FOR RMA, YOU need go through phone support troubleshooting process, which is only 90 days phone support and you need to pay if you want more than 90 days!!! My first troubleshooting taking 2 hours on the phone until support give up and decide to proceed with RMA. after 3 months RMA have same issue again and they want me to do troubleshooting on phone before process with RMA but for that I need to pay $49 for one time troubleshoot if they can fix the issue. I'm done with NETGEAR! I have other brand network device and never have issue with RMA request.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy5

customer_reviews.title: Not recomended
customer_reviews.text: I have three in this series at different residences. This one drops different devices randomly. The problem is it seems to lose the security/safety devices. Seems like it started with the update following the switch from "genie" to "nighthawk" software/management from netgear. Now they are constantly pushing their "circle" security product as well. One of the other nighthawk routers drops streaming devices randomly following an update too. I have used netgear equipment for years without any issues but now have 2 of 3 nighthawk routers misbehaving. Such a shame. Time to move on I guess. Not recomending these.
customer_reviews.author: H. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it stops working (got worse over time In less than a year)
customer_reviews.text: Update: I’ve had this for 9 months now and it’s only getting worse. It constantly turns off and when we try to connect (making sure the password is spelled correctly with all the right caps) it will still say it’s wrong for the first couple times. It won’t connect to certain devices anymore either like our security cameras and soundbar system. Changed the password several times already too but it’s pointless because it ends with the same result. (Feb review) Not sure what’s going on, it worked amazing at first but then we kept having to change its password and reset it because it would randomly stop. Overall I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Kc

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is Awful
customer_reviews.text: I recently downloaded the most up to date firmware version which is 1.0.4.28 and found that the router kept dropping the internet connection. I spent a full day troubleshooting the problem because I work from home. I missed a deadline and a conference call because of this piece of junk. Netgear support is terrible. There was no obvious way to notify them of their firmware problem aside from buying a support contract. This is the last time I buy a netgear product. It's obvious they know nothing about creating quality routers that actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Brown

customer_reviews.title: When it works its good. Mine drops connection once a day since I ...
customer_reviews.text: AC1750: When it works its good. Mine drops connection once a day since I bought it, straight out of the box this way. Updated to new firmware and everything. I've checked online forums on Netgear and everything it seems like a hit or miss with this one. Some people get a fuzzy product and others get a good one. But the big problem is there is no fix, on all the forums the netgear techs just stop replying after they give the usual answers '' reset it, update firmware." There is no actual fix for this. So try replacing it or returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Kirk

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t the R6700 as described!!!
customer_reviews.text: I only just now noticed that the product I’ve ordered and used for an entire year isn’t the R6700 but the R6700v2 which is the worst version compared to the original R6700 and the newer R6700v3. if I knew that I didn’t get what I paid for when received. I would’ve bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nobodyknows808

customer_reviews.title: VPN Ready
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work with ExpressVPN. The setups was straightforward and easy. I was able to load ExpressVPNs software and have it protecting my web traffic in about 15 minutes. Would highly recommend for anyone who wants to run a VPN on their router.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Garbage...absolute garbage.  Do not buy from this company.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Would not broadcast WiFi. After 3hours on the phone with NETGEAR tech support- if was able to broadcast WiFi less than 20ft. Then the tech tried to talk me into buying a booster. Why would I spend $150 on a product that requires a booster to work? Huge waste of money. Save yourself some money and buy a router for 1/2 the price- you will get the same functionality. To add to this nightmare, immediately following my phone conversation with the NETGEAR Tech- someone from Southwest Asia (the location of the tech) tried to hack into the very email I was using to setup this router. Mmm.
customer_reviews.author: Lonny R Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Known Disconnect Issues - Beware
customer_reviews.text: Do not Buy, I almost never write reviews, but felt compelled in this case. My previous WiFi router went bad late last year. It, too was a Netgear. I figured I would upgrade to a better model and get great performance right? Not so much. For about two months it was great. Then it started going downhill and fast. Now, it disconnects from the Internet several times a day. Now I’m shopping for yet another router...not a Netgear this time. Do an Internet search on the R7000 and disconnects. It’s a huge problem with these things.
customer_reviews.author: T888

customer_reviews.title: Slow and clunky.  Died after six months.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Supposed to handle a large number of devices but speed degrades quickly as you get past 10. Also supposed to handle large houses but can't reach to the back corners of my 4k open plan house. Admin interface is slow an clunky, not intuitive. Lasted 6 months and has now died. Unable to access the Admin to portal. Unable to access the Internet. Looking at my wired connection, keeps dropping the connection and cycling through IP addresses when it re-established the connection. Don't waste your time or money. Try a different brand of router.
customer_reviews.author: Milton

customer_reviews.title: Not even 4 months old
customer_reviews.text: So I was sooo inlove with this router... loved the features and everything... So i shut off my computer (Was just online) go watch tv after a long day and no internet, go check out the router to a blinking orange power light.... i wait a wile and still orange. attempt to power cycle and still same result.... tried reset to factory same result..... contact netgear and they have me TFTP flash router - same result....then want me to ship it to them... nope not going to happen at my expense... done with netgear done with the company. i shoulda just bought another ASUS, iv had nothing but trouble with netgears.....figured to give them another go but i was wrong
customer_reviews.author: robert goulet

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible router.  I feel completely ripped off.
customer_reviews.text: Slows down over days. Reboot fixes it for a few hours. Netgear's support forums are FULL of reports of this slowdown/reboot. Going back a couple of years. No fix. "Connected devices" screen in router administration often does not show devices that are connected and working. "DHCP assignment" (i.e. static ip) doesn't work. And so on and so forth. Very bad for a router this pricey. They should be embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: Danal

customer_reviews.title: Bricked after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT allow your router to update itself via the user interface... I learned this too late. Now I have a $200 pile of junk in my closet. Their support was not helpful, and suggested buying a new unit. So now apparently I have to buy a USB-TTL adapter, crack the unit open and manually attempt to reflash the firmware as the factory reset sequence does not work. Look elsewhere and purchase a router with decent support and better tested firmware rollout. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I did my research before I bought this router. Thinking that netgear was a well established brand I trusted the ratings and pricing for an AC router. I was wrong. After the firmware update the router was unusable, causing issues with disconnecting every 3-5 minutes. I tried reverting to a previous firmware version and it did nothing. Upon googling the model number turns out this issue plagued many other people and Netgear has been less than helpful in troubleshooting, short of offering an exchange. Given how frequent and pervasive the issues are, I'd recommend skipping this one. I went for another router instead and haven't had issues since.
customer_reviews.author: John Weng

customer_reviews.title: Bad for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This router has not performed anywhere near as well as I would have hoped. There are several gaming consoles and other devices that constantly get disconnected if they are running the same game. The nat translation settings sometimes resolves this issue but different games require different settings which is a major annoyance when you want to switch back and forth between games. The user interface for changing the settings also looks like it was made for people who know nothing about networks. That's fine considering many users probably enjoy the simplicity, but expect to have to do some digging to find configuration menus for pretty common features. 0/10 will never buy from Netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: Snuts

customer_reviews.title: Fast Router But Beware of Parental Control Called Circle by Disney -- Basic Service Offers Next To Nothing Useful.
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and responsive but unfortunately the Circle from Disney parental control is a bit misleading. Read multiple reviewers citing that the free version of Circle from Disney parental control will allow for time scheduling. It doesn't. It only allows manual pausing of the said device. Got rid of it. Otherwise, a great router if you don't need the parental control which I needed but didn't want to pay monthly just to control time scheduling. If you want time scheduling for free, get the Asus RT-AC68U. That's what I did and I'm happy as a pig in sh*t. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Richard Soh

customer_reviews.title: "Wireless Bridge" feature does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router specifically to use as a "wireless bridge" to connect to my existing Netgear R7800 (operating on a DFS channel). It does NOT work. A Google search pinpoints the problem. Netgear never certified the R6700v3 with the FCC to operate as a wifi client on DFS channels. Instead, Netgear only certified the router to use DFS channels only the router is configured as a router (not a "wireless bridge"). And it seems this is a common problem for many Netgear routers -- in "wireless bridge" mode will fail to connect to a router using DFS channels. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: A fair reviewer

customer_reviews.title: this would be a great router. If you depend upon a home network
customer_reviews.text: While the Wi-Fi worked well, and was fast, this router was very problematic with my home network. Even though I'm quite adept at setting up a network (I was a network professional before retiring), I could not get my already established home network to operate correctly with this router. Access between devices was excruciatingly slow. Each device could access the internet very quickly, but just not speak to each other without a very long "handshake" that would often cause apps to time out or fail. If you just want to share internet access, this would be a great router. If you depend upon a home network, I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls cost $60 a year!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine, but the feature of parental controls costs $60 a year extra which is not disclosed anywhere prior to buying this. Nowhere on Netgears website do they say that the Circle functionality which allows you to set time limits, set bedtimes and other functions cost extra money on an ongoing basis. The only thing you can actually do on the Nighthawk app that's no charge is pause a connection. Very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Netgear -- 6 months tops for their products
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing in February. Been running okay. Did a firmware upgrade now i get about 5 Mbps downstream on the lan connection. Wifi is okay at around 50 Mbps. Did a factory reset, took an hour to get it back on line and the same result. Netgear quality has seriously dropped over the last few years. I cannot afford to "ship it back" for repairs, so in the garbage it goes. Avoid this brand if possible. Oh, and if I want support I get to pay for it. Nice.... Update, 40 minutes on hold for tech support to be told I cannot return it unless tech support says I can, first pay to trouble shoot. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Baker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this AC2300 Nighthawk R7000P Router. Crashes 2.4 Ghz channel daily
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this AC2300 Nighthawk R7000P Router. It's very basic operation is to perform at the 2.4Ghz level. This router on a daily basis crashes on 2.4Ghz. I called support and they immediately asked me to change the Fragmentation Length (256-2346) to 1905 and the CTS/RTS Threshold (1-2347) to 1906. This worked for a day and then started failing. I just can't justify paying this much for a router that fails where my past Linksys E3200 was a work horse (albeit it slower) and never crashed. BTW, I am not a novice user and used to work for a router company years ago.
customer_reviews.author: gregory hensley

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: This device was registered to someone else. Support couldn't help me and neither could Netgear. It was an all around terrible experience. I just wanted to know why it wasn't acknowledging that I was connected to WiFi during setup. I later learned, by my technician for my Xfinity provider, that when it's being stubborn, try setting it up directly connected to a PC. I'm pretty tech savvy if someone would of just told me this 🤷🏼‍♀️ I would up getting a new one from a retail store. It's a nice router. I'm not sure this house let's it live up to it's full potential though.
customer_reviews.author: Stickie

customer_reviews.title: Staying away from netgear
customer_reviews.text: My netgear R6400v2 started losing internet every few minutes so after replacing the modem with no resolution I decided to replace the router next. I went with this R6700v3 and initially it worked until it suggested a firmware update. Then it started doing the same thing as the router I replaced except instead of just dropping the internet it reboots itself every ten minutes. I looked on the netgear website and both my old router and new router had firmware updates dated 9/30/20, the exact date I started having internet issues. I shouldn't have to search for a fix for something brand new. I'll be returning this router and staying away from netgear from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Finnegan

customer_reviews.title: FIRMWARE UPGRADE WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded to the latest firmware revision (V1.4.1.42_1.3.4) and it has serious bugs. One is that it wipes out the LAN Setup. Then it would not allow us to save or edit Device Names in LAN Setup. The upgrade also wiped out our port forwarding settings. Netgear hires off-shore programmers because they are CHEAP. There is also a complete lack of QA/QC. Netgear is known for firmware upgrade disasters. Well, this is the inevitable result of such policies. I would suggest either looking for a better brand or avoid their firmware updates.
customer_reviews.author: Tiberius Gracchus

customer_reviews.title: Fast router with ads
customer_reviews.text: The router does what they advertise and more. It's fast on wired and wireless connections, it has an easy to understand interface, and it has embedded ads with web activity tracking (not advertised). Upon powering up the router for the first time I was greeted by a TOS agreement page. Wait, why does a router have such a thing? So I read it. This router will advertise to you, monitor device activity and web activity of your devices then report the details to Netgear. See attached screenshots. Factory reset router and returned. Never buying Netgear again. Two stars instead of one because it is fast / does what they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt.ScrewUp

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the beginning but wil start to have issues after free Tech support expires.
customer_reviews.text: This router work great in the but it seems that after the free tech support expired I started having signal loss and weak uploads and downloads. I would be in the back yard and have full strength but things would not download and I could be watching TV in the room next to the router and the picture will get fuzzy for some seconds and then the picture would come back. I reboot the router once a week and still have the issues.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Boost in speed
customer_reviews.text: This item comes with no instructions and after 45 minutes of trying to set it up with Fire Fox browser, I gave up and was going to return to Amazon. However, after a quick check on the internet, I found you need to use Chrome to set up. With Chrome, I was up and running in 10 minutes. With no instruction in the box, I am sure many will have problems with a set up. I will avoid NetGear in the future because of this. NeatGear does have a 126 page PDF manual online but nothing about not being able to set up using Firefox browser so 0 stars for support and setup instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Failed twice. Not a good unit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a unit. Installed as instructed. Hooked it into an existing ATT router and enabled the wifi. Paired well with all my devices, setup was easy and signal was strong. After less than a week, the orange power light was solid. No restart worked. Factory reset did not work and amazon sent another unit as this one was defective. Set up the new unit. Tried a new power source and surge protector (just in case it was a power issue). After 4 days this one failed as well. I was tired of spending all my time troubleshooting these units so I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stacy

customer_reviews.title: We don’t reccomend this router
customer_reviews.text: Terribly disappointed with this item. We replaced our 5 year old router with this and this worked a lot worse than the older one. We would have to reset it at least a few times a week. This past week it died...after 9 months. Would love a way to send an email through Amazon for solution options but it’s been too long and I have to deal with the customer support team over the phone. Sigh....
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten V. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace my Apple Airport Extreme, which had been rock solid perfect for about 10 years. The Netgear is a huge disappointment. Clunky admin interface, which logs you out too quickly, IP address reservation usually doesn't work at all, networking Macs is more troublesome than it should be, and now with the latest firmware (V1.3.1.44_10.1.23) the admin interface claims exactly ZERO devices are attached even though my 12+ wifi devices in the house are all actually connected and working fine. This zero attached devices problem is apparently a bug with the latest firmware, because it's affected lots of other people too. This will definitely be my last Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Router forwards port without being asked to
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a good router/wi-fi hot spot. Right out of the box, the router forwards port 80 to the last DHCP attached device without being asked to. In my case, it's a security camera. The port forwarding table is empty. Customer support is horrible. Woman with no technical knowledge twice tried to get me to contact the manufacturer of the camera. Tech support guy left a phone message late at night and then disappeared. There was a comment to the trouble ticket asking for the best time to call but I haven't heard from them since. Apparently support is in the Philippines and there are language issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Lane

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT Work Well as Access Point
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these units, and they are excellent routers. However, configuring either as an access point to extend WiFi on my network is a complete failure. Why? Because the 450Mbs+ speed on the router-configured unit drops to 0.83Mbps when you configure it as an access point. This appears to be a long-outstanding defect in the firmware (shared by may NetGear devices, and has been an unaddressed problem for at least three years. A recently purchased AC1200 (EX6120) has the same problem when it is configured as an access point. If you need an access point, buy something else. These units can't match the speed dial-up modems of 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: R.MacLean

customer_reviews.title: Major issues with this router
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, this router worked perfectly. Very fast and reliable connections. Unfortunately, after about 14 months, the router started experiencing major issues. It would sporadically drop internet connection, first it happened about once every 2 weeks, now it's occurring multiple times per day. I suspect it happened after a firmware update, I researched online and many other users are experiencing the same thing. I have yet to find a fix for this issue. If I cannot resolve this in the next week I will be forced to purchase a new router. You can guarantee it won't be a Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Aric

customer_reviews.title: While I do have better wi-fi connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I've had almost continuous problems since I bought this router. Whereas I used to have to reboot the router once a quarter, I now need to do it twice a week. To be fair, networking is complex and I can't be 100% certain the problems I've experienced the last few weeks are because of this router. That said, I suspect this router to be the culprit. I expected an improvement in service but got the opposite to a major degree. While I do have better wi-fi connectivity, having to constantly re-boot the router is just awful. I very much regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NickyD

customer_reviews.title: Constantly have to reboot
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to throw this piece of garbage away. I have to reboot it almost every day because my internet speed gets throttled down so slow (and it takes forever to reboot) The Nighthawk app has a speedtest built in, which always tests at my provider purchased internet speed (100 Mbps) My connected devices are often throttled into the Kbps range until I reboot the router. It may be coincidence, but it seems my wife and my iPhones have the most trouble. I'll reboot my phone and sometimes its just my phone. Sometimes its both our phones and a phone reboot doesn't help. Sometimes its all connected devices Really frustrating
customer_reviews.author: BTR

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: EDIT*** now our 2.4ghz band doesnt work half the time either. We are giving up and buying another brand router, tired of trying to be an IT department to troubleshoot this one Failed after a year and a half, out of warranty so we cant get any help from Netgear. The 5ghz connection has disappeared, the app does not connect to the router half the time, and when we try to test the connection it always tells us to reboot, even after we have rebooted. There are higher quality routers out there for less expensive, do your homework and get one from a company with reputable customer service
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few days at a time.
customer_reviews.text: When this router worked, it was great. Unfortunately, the up-time was 2-3 days max and then I'd have to reboot it to restore functionality. Every time it would go offline, I'd try another fix. I rolled back the firmware (which seems counter-intuitive, but it worked...for 2-3 days.) I adjusted settings. I did a factory reset. Nothing could keep the router working at top speed on 2.4 GHz for more than a few days. (We have security cameras that need a 2.4 GHz connection.) Eventually, I had enough...and decided to buy another brand of router: a TP-Link Archer AC2300. It's had ZERO issues and maintained high speed on 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz connections ever since I plugged it in.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Caszatt

customer_reviews.title: Fast router - difficult setup
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because the setup wizard would not recognize my gateway. The gateway is an Optical Network Terminal (ONT). My ISP uses fiber optics for internet and TV. After downloading the 215-page manual the solution was on page 202. After several resets, the router finally completed a handshake with the ONT. This router is replacing an EERO that is being returned because there is virtually no access to the router configuration. Luckily, I kept my old router to connect and download the manual. If it works reliably for a couple weeks, I will revise my rating.
customer_reviews.author: The Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Connect, Terrible Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to connect to my internet despite Xbox being able to wire in and work immediately, as well as an older router. Called my ISP and no issue on their end. Called Netgear and spent over an hour trying to understand the lady while she walked me through things I had already tried off of a basic Google search (hard reset etc.). Tried Amazon tech support and it was the same call center using the same case number... pretty sure they just send you to the company you purchased from. This is the second router (different brand) that I have had this issue with. Back to using my old router to write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Contacted Netgear and they ran diagnostics remotely They confirmed it was a faulty router and promptly sent us a new one via fed
customer_reviews.text: Installed this router and within 5 days it died. Contacted Netgear and they ran diagnostics remotely They confirmed it was a faulty router and promptly sent us a new one via fedex and we returned the bad router. Router #2 installed on Sunday died on Tuesday. Funny while all of this was going on we purchased a router from Best buy for half the price to get us thru and the $70 router is working well. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Defective Item
customer_reviews.text: I spent 1 hour 52 minutes on the phone with the technician to try to reconfigure this router. It worked. The next morning it was NOT working. I called Spectrum to ask them to check on the item. I was told that the internet connection was working, but the router was not. She proceeded to instruct me how to restart the router by placing a toothpick in the little round hole in the back of the modem and router. It worked for 10 minutes and then quit. I returned the router.
customer_reviews.author: exteach

customer_reviews.title: Trash firmware with no support
customer_reviews.text: Netgear released this as a mini update before releasing the next round of routers and it has issues in the current and recent firmware releases, but despite it being so frequent, the company refuses to address it, making a lot of the features the hardware supports not usable. Go with another company or another router from Netgear that has DDWRT available for it, as this one does not.
customer_reviews.author: ethan britt

customer_reviews.title: Horrible router, horrible tech support
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS (or ANY) NETGEAR router. I have had this close to one year and the hardware warranty was in effect. Recently, the router speed has dropped by 1/3. NETGEAR’s Tech Support was contacted as there is a 1 year warranty on the hardware. According to NETGEAR if their router is on, the hardware is just fine. The warranty does not cover their router for performance!! If it’s got even the speed of 1 mbs, the warranty doesn’t cover it. Their tech support also wanted $89.99 to troubleshoot the device! I’ll never buy another NETGEAR product again-neither should YOU!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A screamer and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to set it up. Instructions were clear and easy but some things still didn't work. Turns out the CAT5 cables were bad to those devices! lol This thing is a screamer and with all of our devices attached, I see no slow down in bandwidth. I love the switching function that allows different speed devices to connect to the best channel so they don't slow the faster devices down. It is also wonderful that you can turn off all the blinking lights -one of my pet peeves with earlier models.
customer_reviews.author: frodoboyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Meet Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This replaces older generation Netgear which was starting to buffer streaming. Somehow this thing goes off and disappears, requiring turning off and on-then waiting for it to find itself. It affects a TV in another room; have no idea why. When turning the TV on, just shows an initial page Before set-up. Has proven to be unreliable, requiring constant babysitting. When working, seems to have taken care of the buffering problem. When trying to get help, typical language hassle which ends in adios. All of this usually happens after it's been sitting awhile. Instructions for set-up are lousy for non-techies.
customer_reviews.author: CaptMorgan

customer_reviews.title: Router was great at first. But now.........
customer_reviews.text: The good . Internet is fast on wireless devices. The bad 1. After about three months router Hass to be reset like once a week because it loses connection to the Internet. 2. I truly miss the days of routers that don’t require you to log into some stupid service they can charge you for . Constantly pushing you to download their protection service software which I don’t want and their app is a joke basically they want you to register everything online so you can have access to a router you bought. I would not recommend this to anyone after dealing with it for the last four months.
customer_reviews.author: daniel mckee

customer_reviews.title: Drops 5Ghz Signal
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the R6900P. Router worked great initiallly, setup was relatively easy after some trouble getting the modem and router to sync, and speeds were high. However, within a few weeks, the 5Ghz band has started to drop out intermittently! After some searching around, it turns out this is a common issue for this router. Luckily the problem has showed up early enough that I can still return it (I had about a week and a half left). Amazon, you should be aware of this issue and stop selling defective routers! This is a waste of time for me and anyone else that has to spend time setting up a router that will only fail later.
customer_reviews.author: spencer k whitman

customer_reviews.title: not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up, even for a non-tech person. One complaint, many of the troubleshooting tips are PC based; which doesn’t help if you’re only using wireless devices. However, the app does help with this issue. Router stopped working and now shows as registered to someone else. Amazon is willing to provide an exception to replace - I would hope so. Update 6.16.19 - the router has been replaced, but it still doesn’t work great. I have internet connection of 200Mbps, but the router only transmits at 2Mbps - what a piece of junk. I’ve spent hours working with tech support and I’m ready to return it (AGAIN!!)
customer_reviews.author: tinykulab

customer_reviews.title: Product works fine but NO customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We've owned our product for 9 months. Although our internet seems to work just fine, customer service in nonexistent. I wanted to reset the password. I go to the website and they say my security answers are wrong. There is no option to reset by email etc. So I call in. You can not get into the calling que without a case number. You have to PURCHASE A HELP PLAN to get a case number. I can't even get through to a person. What kind of company doesn't offer customer service?!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace an older Apple wifi router. Apple doesn't make them anymore and I thought a new router would give me a boost in performance. After reading the reviews, I bought this one. Setup was pretty easy initially but the firmware was pretty buggy. It took a long while for the router to update to the latest code. Throughout, the router was problematic. It would frequently just stop working and would need to be rebooted. After another firmware update, it was better. It no longer required daily rebooting but still needed to be restarted every few days. The performance was also poor when multiple devices were active.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't died yet.
customer_reviews.text: Device works ok, but 5g signal is very weak compared to other routers I've owned. Also, customer support is AWFUL. I have two other routers that are less than a year old that are bricks now. A firmware update killed one and another just quit. You have to pay for customer support past a certain purchase period. One may ask why I bought this one. I don't understand myself except after trying TPlink, which died within 6 months, I couldn't find a comparable product except Netgear. I will cross my fingers and hope this EXPENSIVE thing lives another day. NETGEAR CUSTOMER SUPPORT IS A SCAM.
customer_reviews.author: ARLOVER

customer_reviews.title: Bad support/warranty
customer_reviews.text: Firmware crapped on mine and could not reflash it myself using their tools. Their support is awful. You only get support for 90 days, after that it is another $90 for 6 months or they wont help you over the phone (seriously). If you are having warranty issues at 6 months like I am, then you have to pay for the $90 support to get access to the ability to send in your warranty repair. never buying netgear ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There Nighthawk App to set this up SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be working very well but the Nighthawk application is a POS. I have had two recent Netgear purchases. The first one I gave up on because we never could get it set up. Then I bought this. Surprise! couldn't get this one working with their app either. I ended up connecting it through my computer. That worked but what a Pain in the A$$. For what this thing costs, it should self install and just work. So far it has boosted our WiFi and is significantly better than the WiFi we were getting off the Cheap service provider modem!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Mayville

customer_reviews.title: Best router for the price that money can buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple issues when setting this up and called customer support. Within minutes I was up and running with incredible speeds. This is a great tri-band router, we have 10 devices connected, 3 computers, 1 tv (streams shows), 2 kids tablets, 2 phones, and 2 ecobee thermostats.. we never have any issues with lag or pixelation when streaming. The security and monitoring features are also fantastic! I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a “Best bang for your buck router! It also looks pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Oiling Mama

customer_reviews.title: Keeps locking up the network when I turn on or wake up a computer
customer_reviews.text: Check the Netgear help section for this router and you will see a dozen topics about how this router locks up and has to be reset by cycling power. It happens to my family every. single. day. Wake up my HTPC? No network. Turn on the XBox One? No network. The only that doesn't do it is my main computer which is on 24/7. I can get rid of this by turning on QoS but that HALVES my download speed from 980Mbps to 488 Mbps. Time to buy another brand. EDIT: Bought the Linksys - Max-Stream AC2200 Tri-Band Wi-Fi Router (EA8300). Works fine, no issues. Geez.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Pombrio

customer_reviews.title: Poor software
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal was good, but the management software is simplistic and seems buggy. It lacks features included with ASUS, such as parental controls and assignment of devices to specific bandwidths. The router crashed almost every time I saved a setting, requiring a hardware re-booting - and once a reset to factory settings. From their support forums, this seems to be commonplace. After dealing with it for a day I decided life was too short - and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bozos

customer_reviews.title: Best router for kids/signal at far distances
customer_reviews.text: I originally was going to return this, I couldn’t get it to work properly with the extended that I bought. However, it shocked me when I disconnected the extender and reset everything the signal connected to my two tiny homes on my far. One is about 40-50 feet from my house and the other is maybe 70- 80 feet. I cannot believe they both have signals. It’s not a super high signal but enough for streaming Netflix. This was also amazing for blocking explicit content! I love the control I have with the app I can disconnect or connect any device from my app, I can block certain sites. It was wellllll worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Curlydiva

customer_reviews.title: Slower then my 4 year old Apple Airport Extreme
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this router thinking that it would be faster than my four-year-old Apple router. I pay for1 gigabit internet and my modem handles up to 1.4 gigabits. When I'd run speed tests I would get about 340 megabits per second. Once I swap out routers this one was only giving me like 200 megabits per second. Nothing else in the signal chain changed except for the router. So what was the point of me holding on to this router considering my old one provides way faster speeds? So I sent this back after only using it for a couple days for a refund and reconnected my Apple AirPort Extreme router
customer_reviews.author: Blood & Fire

customer_reviews.title: It does the job very well
customer_reviews.text: My old router was getting weak with the fact that everybody had to work from home. So i bought a new router. It covers my house very well and gives me a strong signal outside on the yard. But when i needed to connect it to my older router to use it with computer that does not have wi-fi, the customer service was not helpful at all. They did try hard to help, but they just did not know how. So i turned to experts on good friend YouTube and, thanks to their videos, i was able to connect properly and make it all work. Overall i am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zinaida K.

customer_reviews.title: drops signal every night
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this router. But it drops internet signal every night. I've tested the modem/ONT coming to the house and that signal continues to work fine, so it's clearly this router. Done all of the factory resets and reboots, but to no avail. Waiting for a different brand to get in stock then I'm throwing this away, along with the extenders.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Zonvil

customer_reviews.title: Beware of bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: As many other posters have raised, beware of the bait and switch here. The product you will receive is not the r6700 but rather the v6700 v3 which is a much different specs with different features. The v3 version does NOT have smart-connect for example. And the strange thing is that v3, the setup wizard hasn't change, so it will take you through the steps of setting up "smart connect" even though those toggles are missing from the UI.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had not wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I replaced my ASUS router with this router, my network and connected devices had issues. I have tried every configuration that makes sense for a home user with 50+ connected devices via wired and wireless. I have used Motorola, TPLINK, ASUS, Netgear, Cisco, Linksys, D-Link and other ISP-provided routers over the last 30 years and this is the worst. I guess this is an example of the most expensive is not necessarily the best. I replaced the Netgear router with my ASUS and all back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis From Texas

customer_reviews.title: Does everything a Wireless Router needs to do
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install, I’m a 64 year old woman with limited tech skills. I had no problem removing my previous 5 year old Netgear and installing this router and connecting to my internet providers modem. Netgear App on my iPhone gives me easy access and control. I have a 1700 square foot two story home and this device is running 7 devices (iPads, Roku and Smart Tv’s) with no lag time, no buffering daily and twice that amount on weekends when grandchildren visit. Would recommend, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MGreene

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Airport Extreme and Optimum Router
customer_reviews.text: We were getting lockups which required us to continuously reboot our routers. Not sure what caused it but seemed to me like an IP conflict. I ditched the Optimum router connected to my cable modem and then ditched my Airport Extreme which is wired to the other router. With 3 floors and not routers on 2 of the 3, I seem to have coverage throughout the house. Internet speeds seem great and connecting devices seems quick. One note, I simply set the same SSID and password as my old router and everything reconnected to the new routers. I/m happy with this router.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product, Worse Customer Suppport
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great out of the box. Seven months later and a firmware update (that I did myself rather then paying $$$ for support), speeds are still super super slow, hardwired, through router. Direct from modem 300mbps++. The catch, and I believe from what I read online, Netgear's strategy, is it to hook the consumer into a product, somehow cause issues with a product and then gouge them for extra PAID tech support. Remember what HP did with printer cartridges.....
customer_reviews.author: SammyD

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product, Wifi constantly goes out
customer_reviews.text: I originally rated this product at 3 stars for decent Wifi signal across the home (our house is 2,000 sq ft for reference), but since then we have repeatedly had issues with this product. The Wifi signal cuts out constantly, and we confirmed that it was not the Cable companies fault, and we even purchased a new modem to try to isolate the issue. After all this, the router stops working constantly. When it does work the signal and speed is fine, but we have had too many issues lately for me to recommend this product. We'll be upgrading to Google Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Tech bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is an awful router with awful technical bugs and awful customer support. Netgear refuses to help at all after 90 days and within the 90 day window, their free support did not correct the issue. The router regularly reboots and will “hibernate” at night causing a restart every time it goes hours without being used. None of their solutions worked. Furthermore, there is a bevy of customer complaints with the same issue and solutions aren’t definitive. The language in “debugging” is for tech nerds. NOT recommended. 4 months old and we have to get a new router already.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR R6700 Nighthawk AC1750 Version 3 Trash can filler
customer_reviews.text: Wired speeds are slow but my WiFi speed are horrendous and useless. 500Mbps service I am getting around 300Mbps with a wired connection on 4 different PCs. Anything using WiFi my speeds are 20-30Mbps. Do your self a favor and look at the Netgear help forums for this router. I wish I had. I updated the firmware I made sure QOS was turned off and various other tips and tricks I have read on the Netgear forums. I have a Netgear modem and switch that I am very happy with. I though this would pair up nicely but back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Denni

customer_reviews.title: Speedy, when it works
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have covered the basics, so I'll just add that I'm one more technologically sophisticated user who has nonetheless experienced issues with this router. The good news is that basic setup is simple, so even if you don't know much about networking, you can get rolling, and performance is good right out of the box. The bad news is that it locked up one week after the return period expired. I did a factory reset and it's working again for now, but if you're looking for a reliable, set it and forget it router, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: REV

customer_reviews.title: Always needs to be reset
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this router from an AC1200 Linksys. This routed would constantly lose signal and have to be reset in order for the internet to work. Even the wired connections were dropped consistently. It would work for a awhile, but then all signals, both wi fi and wired, would drop. Resetting the router would make it work, but it is annoying to have to constantly reset the router just to finish a movie. I went back to the Linksys, which is not as fast, but it works without having to be reset all the time.
customer_reviews.author: David Paap

customer_reviews.title: Do not burn your money
customer_reviews.text: Like all home networking gear anymore, this is hot garbage. Router died in 18 months in a cooled, clean environment. Randomly decided that it only wanted to allow the first three devices that attempted to connect to wifi, and just ignore the rest. The internal web pages for settings and troubleshooting would no longer load, even on devices with full lan and internet connectivity. The app is sub par. Several features do not work at all, and have errors every time I tried to use them since day one. I miss the days when Cisco owned lynksys and they mad quality home wifi.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roll

customer_reviews.title: There are MUCH better models out there
customer_reviews.text: I should have done more review reading before purchasing this. There are MUCH better models out there. This one REBOOTS all the time, dropping ALL network traffic. It's a nightmare being used as a wireless AP. Your devices connect, transfer data, DROP, and search for NEW wifi access points CONSISTENTLY . It's garbage! That being said - when you DO connect - it's lightning fast. I'll be throwing it away and getting a new one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Derek W.

customer_reviews.title: Junk right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, I repeat do not buy, the claims about this not a good router are true. This thing always drops connection. Have to reset it daily. I don't mean turn off and back on. I mean hold down the reset button for 30 secs then go through the whole setup like you're doing it for the first time. Tech support never could figure out what was wrong, they just run you through the same steps over and over. Tried really hard to love this thing but it's just a polished turd. Others claims about this thing is true. Will never buy another netgear product!
customer_reviews.author: Jerad

customer_reviews.title: Netgear should go under
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this in June...of THIS YEAR! Its firmware (as many of the other 1star reviews state is not so hot) It now will not let me look at or configure security options and the usb drive flakes out all the time. You would think I could go get help. I mean...its only been 4 months since I bought it a 1year is usually support for products. Nope. I cannot email, call, or anything else. I can use their stupid discussions community crap which is filled with setup questions and garbage. I will be buying another router now and I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER PRODUCT FROM THESE SCUMBAGS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic F Roche

customer_reviews.title: Solid router, third party FW available
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Linksys router that kept dropping the 5 GHz radio band with the R6700v3 (AC1750) and so far so good. Easy setup and user friendly GUI. I like that I can use third party FW (check DD-WRT forums) if I choose to at a later date. I can’t speak to the tech support thus far since I haven’t had a problem but with all consumer grade HW, the first level support is abysmal to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: ParaBellum

customer_reviews.title: DROPS WIFI SIGNAL
customer_reviews.text: Sooo.... I thought this would be a good router based on reviews. Old router was not as strong also a netgear. Went through the process of setting this thing up and had nothing but problems. When a new device was noted (cell phone in our family) it would drop signal even thou phones were still showing signal. Rebooted a couple times and after reading many reviews outside amazon noted this is a problem with this router. So save your money.
customer_reviews.author: aliciag

customer_reviews.title: Good if it works
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 4 of the Nighthawk WiFi routers, 1900 and 2300 series. Two were DOA, one worked out of the box, one worked after spending (I'm not exaggerating) two full hours with a very patient customer support Rep located in the Philippines, a very patient woman. It turned out to be an internal security software setting, the router was probably a resold return that had been setup by the original purchaser.......Who knows. Anyway the two that work are great with a strong signal. Would I buy again??? I hate to say this, yes, cause I'm a glutton for punishment...
customer_reviews.author: Galen

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM NETGEAR!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy anything Netgear. They give you 3 months of phone support and 1 year of hardware support but you have to pay for the phone support in order for them to troubleshoot the hardware if it goes bad after the 3 months. After that period so my Netgear stuff started kicking everything off the network. I've spent hours on the phone with engineers and hours researching how to get this stuff working consistently but I have to reset daily. The router to tells me that I have entered the won't password and this is a common problem across users according to support sites online. STAY AWAY FROM NETGEAR.
customer_reviews.author: Connor VZ

customer_reviews.title: blinking amber power light
customer_reviews.text: I had Netgear Nighthawk AC1750 router 5 months. I Updated the firmware at purchase, last night it just went bad/ dead. R6700v3 netgear blinks amber / red not white power led. I called netgear, 1 hour of resetting, pinging, shock resetting, and TFT new firmware, the company says hardware has failed. This is not a good router, 5 months, dead. Go for the R7 it is better.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Only 5Ghz bands work.  2.4Ghz fails (common issue)
customer_reviews.text: If you only have 5Ghz device you will be fine. The 2.4Ghz band fails shortly after setup. I tried factory resetting multiple times and each time the same issue reoccurs. Online forums say this is a common issue with the specific product. I tried chat support and they are completely useless. Its really unfortunate. I had high hopes for this product. This definitely puts a sour taste in my mouth for using netgear in the future. I have returned this device. I use both 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz devices, so I need both bands to work. Beware if you require the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jory L.

customer_reviews.title: Great basic router
customer_reviews.text: This router was an upgrade for an older model which stuggled to stream across my devices and I am pleased with it. The signal is strong for pretty much all of my 2 story home and most of the surrounding property outside. It has pretty much all the features the average person would need. I docked a star for not having the ability to do site filtering specifically for the guest network but in all honestly I assumed a modern router would have this functionality and that may have been a bad assumption. In summary, I'd recommend this router for basic use cases including multiple devices, streaming, VOIP, and great range.
customer_reviews.author: TomS

customer_reviews.title: Read if you have Spectrum Internet
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched internet providers to Spectum. I was told if I got my own router I could save $5 a month. I thought it was a good idea because after about a year and a half $5 a month comes to the cost of this router. From the moment the technician got to my house he didn't seem very convinced that the router was going to work. Two hours later I end up accepting the Spectrum router. Not sure if the router really didn't work with their modem or if he is told to push his companies equipment. I guess it will forever be a mystery.
customer_reviews.author: Michellelovesfl

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January and within two months the Circle feature quit working. When we finally had a chance to sit down and see why, it said it needed an update. We start the update and before it completes the update, the whole thing shuts down and now we cannot get it to do anything. We have read forums and have been told that it is corrupted now?!?! We are five months from purchase and support runs out after 90 days. I am very disappointed. I feel like this is a known issue and they should support the customer beyond three months. :(
customer_reviews.author: emilyandnate

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router one year ago and it’s practically useless now. Since I started working at home in February the router would reset numerous times and stop functioning for the rest of the day. I exhausted the forums online and manual, did all the power and factory resets, updated firmware, and nothing helps. Based on forums this is an issue others have as well with no resolution. It doesn’t help there is no live customer support. It is not my isp since luckily I had another router I am using now which works fine. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JFM2218

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router due to the fact that the cable companies router didn't reach certain places in my apt and I was limited to the number of wireless devices I could add to the router. On the cable companies router, I was able to pull my max speed on 5ghz but with this router, I am pulling no where close to it. I like the fact that the signal now reaches the places I needed it to, but now I have less speed. I am torn like a pair of star crossed lovers.
customer_reviews.author: jc_moski

customer_reviews.title: Lost configuration 2 times in 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: And that was that, see the headline. Lost config twice in 24 hours and I lost my patience. And I am no rookie, very well versed in technology, router config is easy but dammit, it should be set the basics and forget. Not set the basics and the router forgets. Back it went
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Router is good if you only want it to work for just past the warrenty.
customer_reviews.text: Router worked great for about 8 months. Had an issue about 2 months into use that was resolved by Netgear free tech support available during the first 6 months. The after 8 months erratic internet connectivity became an issue. I made sure that my provider was not the problem. Direct connection of desktop to internet worked fine. The Netgear when it was working had good speed and Wifi signal but became unreliable as it would not stay connected to the internet. Not happy. It is now headed to the land fill being replaced with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Crawford

customer_reviews.title: LAN issues could not be resolved
customer_reviews.text: Great Wifi coverage, and super simple to set up. We connected a PS4 Pro directly to the router via ethernet cable, but the router interrupted the connection every two hours, kicking us out of a game (Final Fantasy XIV -- error 90006). (Bypassing the router and connecting directly to the modem solved the issue. Wifi connection did not seem to be dropped, either.) Tech support recommended port forwarding, but this did not work. Replies to follow-up messages from tech support were not returned. We ended up getting the Nighthawk XR500 Pro Gaming router, which solved the problem. Unfortunately, Netgear support was not able to resolve the issue before the return window on this item closed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Phelps

customer_reviews.title: This router periodically loses its wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: Read multiple reviews on this router. It was easy to setup and easy to connect to, has decent range around my house but, the wifi periodically shuts off and my devices will not connect. on average I am having to reset the router by restarting it so that the wifi is accessible..at least 2-3 times per week. I don't trust it as my primary wifi so I use my service providers wifi which is much weaker. This negates the whole reason for purchasing this one. sorry guys, not really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this device to replace an 8-year-old router, figuring I'd get a stronger signal. Once set up, I connected my phone to the WiFi — after that, nothing else would connect. After multiple attempts with no success, I packed the device up and returned it. Plugged the old router back in — and everything connected again. Made me appreciate my old Apple Airport router...
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Its slow!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how, but this router is slow as dirt. My internet speed is 50/10 and its tests out that way through any wired device, however after connecting this device and using any wifi connected PC/Phone/Etc, speeds are significantly slower, in the range of 12/10 to 25/10. This is on the 5G and 2.4 wifi connections. I bash this device however Ive also doubled down on the manufacturer as Ive just returned this one and bought the upgraded model. Hoping for better results with that one.. Good luck with this. I think its junk.
customer_reviews.author: L Kabo

customer_reviews.title: Netgear has not honored its RMA
customer_reviews.text: This device worked well for about 1.5 months. After that, it would continually stop on its own and sometimes wouldn't recognize the Intranet connection (which I could verify with a different router). We have had to power cycle about once a day now. I contacted Amazon support and they were kind enough to put me through to Netgear for a replacement. Netgear at that time gave me an RMA number and told me I wold receive a new device in 10 to 14 days and could send back the defective one. It has been 17 days now. I have not received a device. When I check on the RMA status, it says that nothing has been shipped on their side!
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk X6 Smart WiFi Router (R8000) - AC3200 Tri-band Wireless Speed (up to 3200 Mbps) | Up to 3500 sq ft Coverage & 50 Devices | 4 x 1G Ethernet and 2 USB ports | Armor Security
product_meta.description: Model:AC3200 WiFiThe netgear Nighthawk x6 AC3200 router, with breakthrough Tri-band WiFi delivers multiple bands for homes with many WiFi devices. Wifi speed up to 3.2Gbps and 6 high performance antennas provide maximum speed and range. Smart connect allows you to game, stream, and download mega-sized files without lags.. provides an extensible design that enables Service prioritization for data. Design that delivers high availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance. The country of Origin is China. WiFi Range - Very large homes.
feature_bullets: Netgear Armor protects your network and connected devices from Internet threats. Get peace of mind knowing you have the best-in-class anti-virus, anti-malware, and data protection for all your smart devices, smartphones, and computers with a 30 day free trial.
Fast wifi performance: Get up to 3500 sq ft wireless coverage with AC3200 speed (Tri-band up to 600 + 1300 + 1300 Mbps).
Recommended for up to 50 devices: Reliably stream videos, play games, surf the internet, and connect smart home devices.
Wired ethernet ports: plug in computers, game consoles, streaming players, and other nearby wired devices with 4 x 1 gigabit ethernet ports.
Loaded with advanced technology: Designed with a 1GHz dual core processor, 6 amplified antennas, Beamforming+, Dynamic QoS, Smart Connect, Amazon Alexa Voice Controls, and more.
Usb connections: Share a storage drive and printer with any connected device, and create a personal cloud storage to access from anywhere, using the 1x3.0 and 1x2.0 USB ports.

Smart parental controls: Pause device internet access, view site history usage, and filter websites for free. Set online time limits, schedule device internet access, and more for $4.99/month (1st month free trial).
Safe & secure: Supports WPA2 wireless security protocols. Includes Guest WiFi access, DoS, Firewall, VPN, and more.
